intro: Couepia dulcis, commonly known as the sweet couepia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture. Couepia dulcis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
